SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Game extends Object implements Serializable
This class is used as a model representation of the game. All game components such as grid, cards and player library are reachable by using this class. Also, this class offers the method to perform a player move
See Also:

      constructor of the class Game
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • getNumPlayers

      public int getNumPlayers()
      it returns the number of players in the game
      Returns:
      the number of players of the game

    • getGrid

      public ObjectCard[][] getGrid()
      It returns the central grid as matrix of @code ObjectCard
      Returns:
      a matrix representation of the central grid

    • getLibrary

      public ObjectCard[][] getLibrary(String username)
      Returns a matrix representation of the passed user library
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player who owns the library
      Returns:
      a matrix representation of user's library

    • getPlayers

      public Player[] getPlayers()
      It returns a vector with player in the game
      Returns:
      an array containing all the player in the game

    • manageTurn

      public Message manageTurn(String username, Position[] move, int column)
      This method manages a turn. Checks if a move is valid, then insert card in the player's library (and remove it from grid). Finally, it controls common goals.
      Parameters:
      username - the turn player
      move - an array of positions to identify the cells of the grid where the player takes his object cards
      column - the column of the player's library in which he's going to insert the object cards he took in his move

    • findRanking

      public ArrayList<Couple<String,Integer>> findRanking()
      It finds the ranking of player when the game is finished
      Returns:
      the game ranking in the form of an arraylist. Each node of the list is a pair of Name and Points ordered from higher to lower scoring.

    • setNextPlayer

      public void setNextPlayer(String name)
      This method inserts in game a new player with a name. This method is necessary to maintain the order of player
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the player

    • checkEndLibrary

      public boolean checkEndLibrary(String username)
      This method is used to check if the user identified by the parameter has filled his library at the end of the turn
      Parameters:
      username - is the username of the player
      Returns:
      true if the player has a full library

    • getCommonGoalCard

      public CommonGoalCard[] getCommonGoalCard()
      It returns a vector with two common goals
      Returns:
      an array with common goal card of the living room

    • getCommonGoalCardId

      public int getCommonGoalCardId(int index)
      It returns a specific common goal
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the requested card
      Returns:
      the card ID of the goal card in the index position

    • firstLibraryCompletion

      public int firstLibraryCompletion(String username)
      This method is used to assign the point at the center of the living room to a specific user. After this method is called, the points at the center are actually consumed.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player that will gain the points
      Returns:
      the amount of points earned by the player

    • getCentralScore

      public int getCentralScore()
      It returns central points
      Returns:
      The number of points available at the center of the living room.
